text: Benjrong is a great neighborhood Thai place... my husband and I have been getting take-out from here on a weekly basis since they opened and have never been disappointed.  The service is excellent and the restaurant could not be cleaner or more pristine- the entire kitchen is on display (major bonus!).  Favs include their vegetable egg rolls (love that sweet, clear chili sauce), tom yum soup, pad see ew, pineapple fried rice, pad thai, and the currys.  Their hot sauce is great, so are the lunch specials.  The food does not compare to L.O.S. or Komol in terms of the flavor or complexity, but everything I've had has always been fresh and delicious.  I definitely recommend this spot- it is way above average for a local Thai place and is not filthy, dingy, poor quality, or lacking flavor- like so many other local places...!

I eat at this place to date the food is ok but the manager named acom  lady whit fake aye s she don t have the skills to run a business the plate this place serve is miserable for the price I ask for sea food soup and they serve squid soup if u ask were is the rest of the sea food She  said that is the way they serve  so I don't recommend this thai restaurant to no body that is the major reason all day is empty

Disappointed. I usually go to Archie's or Pin Kaow for Thai food but since this place is closer to my house, I wanted to give it a try. The prices are a little higher than other places and that's ok with me IF the food is great. But the food was not great, not even good. It was OK. And it seemed the portions were smaller than other places as well. I won't be going here again.

Great food. Very tasty and generous portion.
Came at 3:58pm and they wouldn't serve the lunch menu anymore (which is until 4pm). Wouldn't give the wifi password as well. 
Only reasons not giving 5 stars

I Definitely would come back to this place, 

I had the Yellow Curry and it was pretty good,The chicken was good but the potatoes in it were kinda odd because they were so hard, but maybe I'm weird!

I'd go again for sure though.

Stopped by around 1 in the afternoon and was the only customer there. Service was excellent, but, to be blunt, the food kind of explained why I was the only customer there. Ordered a chicken pad thai and a beef salad, both were just plain terrible. Was one of the few times I didn't bother asking for a to go box. I'm quickly learning that when you find thai restaurants in Vegas that you enjoy, it's best to stick with them.
So to be fair I ate here the night before going to Thailand. The food was not good the service even worse. I would not recommend

What happened?I used to love this place!
The quality has steadily gone down and has finally hit bottom! The food has no flavor! Particularly the Pad see ew. The curry was only ok! No veggies and a real disappointment! $45 wasted!!!!
I think this place is tastier than Pin Kaow, and Archie's, the other thai places in this neighborhood.

authentic tasting northeastern thai food , I love the curry , pad thai , mint  chicken, chicken satay was juicy.
Legit thai cuisine!

WORST RESTAURANT! 
My finance and I just was there earlier today for lunch.  The girls working were the most rude lifeless servers I've ever come across, no wonder we were their only customers! We ordered Thai iced coffee spring rolls papaya salad and green curry.  She brought us our spring rolls and we asked nicely for some lettuce to wrap them in and she looked like she didn't understand English or she was just stupid! She looked at us as if we were stupid for asking for lettuce, so I didn't want to spend another minute in that horrible place I asked to cancel the rest of the order and give us the check and they refused and said they already made it! We took it to go the papaya salad was horrible it tasted like fish! The curry was way too sweet! The spring rolls were a waste of time! People save your money or just go to subway right next door! To our waitress: maybe find a new occupation where you'll be less miserable and doesn't involve interacting with others! Just a friendly suggestion
3 stars for nice service, but 50 mins waiting for Crab Pad Thai on last Saturday night wasted my time.

My wife and I are big fans of Thai food. We were excited to find out that a new Thai restaurant had opened in our neighborhood. Our expectations were not very high, but this place has surpassed them. 
We have eaten there at least a dozen times in the past couple of months, and everything we've ordered has been wonderful, including Thai BBQ chicken, Benjarong pad thai, beef penang curry, Indonesian fried rice and more. 
Benjarong is a family run restaurant, and the staff is utterly charming. This little gem of a restaurant is a welcome addition to the neighborhood and we wish the owners much success.

This place is sooooooo delish!!! I've tried almost all the other thai restaurants around town, but this place has got to be the best tasting out there.  We ordered the chicken pad thai, fried tofu for appetizers, and the tom yum koong soup (did i spell that right??).  The soup here is the best I've ever had at a thai restaurant!  More sour than spicy, just the way I like it!  =)

i agree the location is very nice and clean. i haven't been to the previous sushi bar, but from the outside the restaurant looks very small. when we actually went inside it seemed larger. the servers were very nice and the food was ok. we tried the dinner menu as take-out one night and then lunch another night. the take-out was much tastier than the lunch dine-in for some reason. overall, not bad to try out. i personally like pin kaow better and their prices are about the same.

We come here for dinner and it's usual slow.  Wait staff used to be good but recently they have slacked with no urgency. 
Food is not consistent...
Pad Thai comes dry or too wet, guess it depends on the cook that day. 
The Pad Se Eu is good, but sometimes it is too salty.
Hopefully this place picks up,  it was really good the first time we came...

My first real Thai food experience and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was decent quality and I ordered a lunch special of sweet and sour chicken and it came with a soup, small salad, small egg roll, chicken satay and Jasmine rice for $10.
The owner Patrick does a great job of capturing an authentic thai flavor. I enjoyed pad thai can't wait to try more. Clean place I had great service.

I frequent this place usually 4-5 times a month. 
The food is usually a hit or miss. Most of the dishes are over priced for it's quality.  I've ordered out many times and the noodle dishes, pad Thai and pad see ew are either cooked well or soggy. They do add a fair amount of meat which is nice. 

The soups are usually pretty good, but they add these strange hard dried out pork bits that makes the dish less appetizing. 

I didn't realize this until recently, but I've been getting overcharged for the pad see ew/ pad Thai dishes in adding chicken when it already is supposed to come with chicken, pork, beef and shrimp. 

The thing that really got me this time around is they charged $2.00 for cilantro without letting me know that there was an extra charge for it. I can understand if i added a meat to the dish for $2., but $2. for cilantro??? That's more than it would cost them for 2 bunches of cilantro at the grocery store. Very disappointed with their dishonesty and lack of customer service. 

Unfortunate to say, this is definitely the last time I go to this place. 

2 and a half stars for the food, but the recent experiences bring the overall stars to a 1.

I have been to this restaurant a 4-5 times over the last few months because I just moved near this area.  

Service:  
It is average.  The servers are friendly and are helpful.

Food:
I have tried following items at the restaurant:
-Thai Omelet
-Homestyle Duck (Level 5)
-Spicy Basil Ground Chicken (Level 3)
-Spicy Basil Eggplant and Pork (Level 1)
-Kabocha Squash Curry with Tofu (Level 5)

The first time I tried this place, I had their thai omelet.  They forgot to put tomato in the omelet-- the only reason why I ordered the dish.  For the tomatoes.  However, I got fresh cherry tomatoes on the side so I was happy.

Overall, the food is too sweet.  I cannot handle hot food very well so I first started with Spicy Basil  Eggplant with Pork spicy level 1.  It was just plain sweet so the next time I ordered spicy basil chicken with level 3.  It tasted the same.  Sweet. After that, I craved for some good duck dish so I got their homestyle duck level 5.  The duck was good and had some kick to it.  However, it was still too sweet.  

Last night I got kabocha curry with tofu level 5.  I did not want to raise my spice level because I was afraid that I might not be able to eat it.  I now regret getting it with level 5 because it was just as mild as level 3 and was sweet.

I am probably going to return to the restaurant because its close. But I won't recommend it to anyone who really want authentic thai food.  Their food is too sweet.

Love these guys one of the more consistent restaurants in the area...
Employees make you feel like you are entering into their cozy Thai home when you arrive at Benjarong...
We always have a great experience with both delivery and eating in ..
Tom Yum and Pad Thai are great dishes here along with many others Thai coffee s a must order for first timers

Decided to try this place for the first time via delivery. The lady on the phone was very nice and thorough in confirming the order. Felt that the dishes were about $1 overpriced, but it's worth paying a little extra for good food. Unfortunately I was quoted about a 90 min delivery time. Would've been much quicker to just go pick it up, but that's the price to pay for laziness.

Had red curry with chicken- good, but nothing spectacular
Mongolian beef- again good, but small portion
Mango with sticky rice- impossible to screw up

Order with tip included came out to almost $40. Perhaps it would've been a better idea to sit down at the restaurant instead of ordering delivery for a first time experience, but overall I wasn't blown away. However if I'm feeling like Thai and absolutely too lazy to drive for it, I might consider Benjarong again. But at the moment, I don't see ordering from them again in the foreseeable future.

OK I was in the area and I was in need of some good spicy food. I was so glad to read about this high rating Thai place as "authentic" by a Thai, and it is just within walking distance!
OH my, the reviews blew my mind away, I was feeling it must be my lucky day to find out another authentic Thai place!!

First impression was good, gentle service girls, answered my questions in soft voices, and their eyes are attentively looking around for customer's sign of needing service, through the big mirror across the side wall.
When I ordered food, I emphasized that I didn't like anything sweet, so they recommended panaang curry, which is something I usually order, it is the most spicy curry in most Thai places in this city.
Well well, the curry was overly too sweet!! I can not believe it.  
 They offered to bring it back to the kitchen and re-make it, but I would not try that (haha, basic common sense to eat at a restaurant that you don't own).  Anyone who has worked in a kitchen would say,"Save it and box it to go!!LOL!!"  So that was what I did.  I brought it back home, add my own spices to dilute the sweetness, and finished the meal.  
I can not think of any reason to go back again, unless I will be in that area and starving.  After all, Thai is my favorite, and I will stick with spicy basil and beef salad, the things that they have more control than pre-made sauces.

I really want to say, that level of sweetness in Panaang curry has no chance to be authentic Thai, I have had so many Thai food in Asia, by top chefs who own successful restaurants in Bangkok.  Maybe chefs/cooks in Vegas are from other areas of Thailand?? I traveled most part of Thailand from south to north, and have never had anything half as sweet in a curry or any entry dishes. 

My favorite place is Komol on Sahara and Commercial, a family owned and operated Thai restaurant.  They are, compare with other places in the valley, the closest to real Thai, and they use the least sugar amount.  When I ask them to cook my meal in Asian way, the way they will eat it, I would not taste sugar in my meal.  

But they say, they have to add sugar otherwise customers will complain.

Today my boyfriend and I ordered a VEGETABLE pad thai lunch special from this restaurant. The food was pathetic, and that is being generous. The pad thai had one piece of broccoli, maybe 2 tiny pieces of carrot, and like 4 half slices of zucchini and a random piece of stewed tomato. In addition to there being virtually no vegetables in my vegetable pad thai, there was also chicken(?) that was so dried and rock hard that it took me a full minute to even identify what it was. There was no traditional pad thai flavor present. The side of cucumber salad they gave me was put in a cup about the size of a container that you would put ketchup in for your fries at a restaurant. The cucumbers were old and sour smelling. I took about 4 bites of my meal and couldn't even stomach any more because the smell made me so nauseous. If you're looking for yummy thai food, you'd be better off going through the dumpster of literally any other thai restaurant than ordering a "fresh" meal here. Definitely never wasting my money on this establishment again.

DO NOT EAT HERE! I wish i could give negative stars!!! 

I have ordered to go or delivery several times and never had a problem until last night...my green curry was obviously DYED with green dye and my husband found many chunks of CHICKEN BONE in his basil chicken and my daughters pad see ew. My husband almost broke his tooth and my daughter could have choked! When I called to let them know and get my money back, they REFUSED to give my $ back. One excuse after another...no manager on site, I don't know how, bring the food back to the restaurant so I can see the bone even though you have a baby and it's 8 at night blah blah blah...after 40 mins on the phone, they finally told me they'd give me cash back the next day. I get here to pick up my refund and I was treated with attitude and them asking why I didn't bring the food back in. I said "so you want me to drive around and work all day with Thai food in my car??!" UTTERLY RIDICULOUS! Then she had the audacity to say "it was just a little bit of bone"!!!! 

Do not eat here. They obviously don't care about their food or patrons. I'm seriously disgusted.

So going to Benjarong was a amazing experience. The restaurant was clean the staff was very friendly and helpful. We tried numerous dishes cause we didnt know what to get we just pointed in the menu and said ok thats what we will get and holy crap there wasnt a dish that tasted bad. I seriously placed myself into food acoma for sure. 

I would highly recommend this place.

The food is great! I am a vegetarian and I still can enjoy a large portion of the menu. I love the spicy basil noodle and egg fried rice and my boyfriend will order the pad thai chicken.  Every time I eat here it is yummy and I crave more. They deliver and have good lunch specials!

This place is pretty good for an "authentic thai" cuisine place in Las Vegas. I moved out here about 5 months ago, and I sure miss home cooked food. The papaya salad, nam tod, and the curry dishes are pretty good. Even the pan fried rice noodle dishes, pad kee mao, are pretty good too. It's close to where I live which is a plus, and the prices are not too bad. If the portions were just a little bit larger then the place would be very good, but all in all, this place is nice because the staff are very friendly to you. Other places are not as friendly and don't check up on ya as well as this place does. If your around, check it out, you'll like it.

One of the best Thai restaurants ever!!!! I really really really enjoy the Padang, crab fried rice, pork jerky, pad se ew, tom yum. So far that's all I ever order. You see when I first went there I only ordered the panang, and every time I go I would try something different well I started to realize that all that food was too much for one person. I cant just order one thing I have to order all of it :( so I'm afraid if I order something else I'll just add that to my list. Every taste is yummy I can't even express it. Just try it. The servers are super nice!!!! The only time one of them made me feel awkward was when I went to pick up dinner and the cashier said " Hey, it's you again!!! I thought you may have forgotten something earlier today from lunch" :( lol.

I starting going to Benjarong about 3 years ago...it was a great Thai restaurant in the neighborhood. I had always gone to Pin Kao but since we moved we thought we try it out. My first couple experiences were good. I told ot friends and family about it. We even had it delivered to our house and ordered their carry out food. I was completely disgusted to find a medium length black hair in the bottom of our Red Curry Chicken- i fed this to my whole family! It wasnt till the second serving that my husband wanted- i found the gross hair. I called to let them know and the reaction i got was that the person on the phone didnt understand and said maybe it was mine! At the time I was a red head and my husband has short hair so nope it wasnt ours....They offered a credit for the red curry. 
A few months go by and we thought, lets give it another try. This time ill pick it up at the restaurant. The food looked good but i realized when we got home, that the white rice that comes with the entree wasnt there and there was only brown rice that i ordered for a woping $2.50 a container. I opened the rice and it smelled like a most sour foul smell ...not normal for brown rice. I took a small bite and spit it out. The rice in a bag was definitely burnt and rancid. I now had no rice to serve to my family with our entree. I went on the the chicken satay appetizer. As i opened the box of food and foil i grabbed 2 skewers and not again...i found  ANOTHER BLACK HAIR!!! I was utterly disgusted my husband was fuming mad. Also that same trip to Benjarong i made sure to tip the server an xtra 10 for a tip.
Well over $20 percent for take out. I really regretted buying this food from them again.The kicker was when i called the lady who handed me my food she said "you must have lost the white rice...i gave it to you, the brown rice is supposed to smell sour and the hair in the food...she denied it again. Im sorry but  im not going to waste $40-60 bucks on food thats rancid, has human hair cooked in it and service that is less than normal and health code appropriate. 
I will NEVER order from Benjarong ever again!!
I dont know whats the matter with who ever runs the place, why the cant keep their hair out of the food they serve others and why the heck they cant admit they mess up people food and dont exhibit clean methods of preparing food but until someone takes responsibility...i think they should be cited and given a fine to clean up their act!

ok.. I haven't Been cooking lately so I tried this Thai resto. I ordered pad Thai and it was alright!!! lack in taste and presentation.. I also ordered the beef jerky.. and omg! it's so bad I didn't eat it anymore and threw it away! it's so salty and hard as a rock I feel like my teeth will have problems if I eat one or two more of these... beef Jerkeys are hard but they are supposed to be chewable.. not these Jerkeys they won't give up the fight.. overall staff is ok but pricey for a low class resto and the food is bad! the one star is for the staff and readiness my food quickly!will never go back again here sorry..
My husband and I aren't just numbers at this place like we are at Lotus of Siam....

I Love Thai food. I started off with an appetizer of Thai Egg rolls, I've had many different Thai places since I've been to Las Vegas, this is by far the best experience I've had so far.  I also had the Musaman Chicken Curry and it was amazing.  I loved every part of it. Great affordable fast delivery. Definitely recommend to everyone.
Really good Thai menu.  Food is always fresh and tasty.  And when I say spicy level 9, they don't assume I can't handle it and they actually make it spicy 9!!!

I've ordered here 4-5 times in the last month or so. Some were delivery some pick up.  Staff is always nice and friendly.  Delivery is quick and under the estimate time.  Most items I've had were excellent and from my white boy experience, authentic.  I did have a couple shrimp that were questionable one time.

Overall, recommended while you are in Southwest Vegas.

This is one of my favorite restaurants ever. I don't really like curry, but have gotten the yellow curry,mild #3 spiciness version. It was amazing!!! I've tried the green version and it was very good. The salmon is great as well. The crab fried rice is also amazing. The pad Thai is pretty good, but I would suggest getting a medium spicy version. I take the curry left overs home and mix with quinoa or rice. I can have happy taste buds for days. 

I don't understand why this place only has 3 1/2 *s. The service is good and the wait staff are very friendly and , yes, they smile a lot. The food is amaze-balls!

Not the best but it's close to work & if I'm craving Thai, I definitely order the Lunch Special. 

Pad Thai is okay, I've said different types of spicy but I honestly feel like they all taste the same. Chicken Sate's pretty good too. But besides that, it's an average place. 

Service is nice, they always offer me a cold glass of water while waiting for my pick up order, which I truly appreciate. Prices are reasonable too, for lunch. Not sure about dinner because I've never been.

When we moved here, this place was good - now:

-DO NOT EAT HERE!

-Overpriced
-poor quality
-poor health department ratings
-staff is pathetically rude!

On 3/24 I ordered a to go soup and rice. When I got home, I realized the soup was just water with some chili on it. Not cooked together at all and missing its normal ingredients.  I called and first employee kept putting me on hold - then spoke with another waitress (named Penny). She what she could do for me, I asked for a refund - she said only the owner could do that, she was just a waitress. I asked to contact the owner or a manager - she said there was no one, they were out of town. I replied asking again for a manager and politely asked her if she knew Southern Nevada Health District requires a manager or PERSON IN CHARGE to always be on property - to which she said "I know, but he is out of town". Then she hung up the phone and didn't answer my return calls.

Being upset by how I was treated, I looked up their inspections on the Southern Nevada Health District website and see they have several B ratings with 20 demerits/violations. Watching how the employee was cleaning the floor and touching the mop with her hands - AND no person in charge as required by law - I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE ANYMORE.

This was my first time here at Benjarong. I've been meaning to try this place for some time now & finally decided to stop by tonight.

I was kind of expecting a "to-go" kind of restaurant, but this is more of a sit-down place, but you can order to go- so I did.  

Location - good! Near my house. Located in southwest, near Rhodes ranch. 

Service - ok. No one greeted me when I first came in but at least I got a thank you when I left.

Food- since I was only ordering for myself, I only got one dish - their Pad Thai  w/ shrimp. I ordered 2 on the spiciness level (I like spicy, but I heard Thai spiciness can be insane!) Overall, it was good & tasty. 

I would come back to this place, but maybe for lunch next time since price is more reasonable and you can get a combo order.
Awesome food and the waitress, Fah was great. Get the pineapple curry! Served in a hollowed pineapple!

* My hunt for some good Thai food in Vegas officially ended without much effort after I had my first meal here.
* Arguably the best fried chicken wanton I've ever had
* Chicken fried ried rice n crispy pork were better than the ones I have had in California
* Big portion and reasonably priced and all the dish I ordered came with a little salad nicely garnished
* Clean and well kept.
So if you are around town try Benjarong. I like to experiment but I am almost always starving so I hesitate to try something new. So be a game and try all the other dishes here, I am sure they will not disappoint you
Portions are small compared to other Thai restaurants in the area overall its good food (ordered the pad Thai )

I love thai food and this is my all time favorite place to eat thai food in Vegas. I come here for lunch almost every week. There is never a wait, their lunch specials are so cheap and so worth it, and they're service is really awesome. All the girls here are so sweet! Highly recommend!

This updated review is for a hidden gem item on the menu that you have to try!!! 

A friend likes this place a lot and even though I don't really like the food personally, it's a passable option when you're being dragged to eat out without a say because you weren't driving...but I digress. 

So on this recent visit I decided to stay away from their lunch special and go rogue. While my dining companion was instagraaaaaming her food with glee, I made a snap decision on some Spicy Thai beef noodle soup. The waitress asked how spicy I wanted it. I was a little surprised by the question, I had to think about it but honestly it's probably because I'm just used to Pho joints where you customize your noodles at the table. 
When the bowl came, it was easily twice the size in volume of noodle than a pho spot and HELLLOOOO flavor explosion! In this soul-satisfying dish, there were delicate rice noodles bathed in a rich beef flavored gingery spiced broth which was not thick or heavy at all. I could also taste a hint of something like anise or allspice. Omg this stuff was goood! I couldn't eat it all there was so much noodle and I found myself feeling kinda sad that I had to leave it 3/4 full. I know some like to take it to go but that's one thing I can't bring myself to do for noodle soup at least. 

Happy I found a new favorite, highly recommend going off the regular menu path and finding other gem items on offer!

Tried this place out for the first time last night.  The food was good and I will definitely come back.  I enjoyed the pineapple curry that was served in a hollowed out pineapple.
There is nothing special about the atmosphere and the muzak was an odd touch so probably best for take out.

Great food and even better service, Cherry has always been so great every time I go there, I wish I could get that kind of service every where I eat. Such nice people, I can't give it any higher review.

This place used to be a Sushi bar. The old place was very limited in space, the bar area took up a lot of the place with only few seating arrangements and not a place for a a small group of people to go.

The redesigned Thai place did an excellent job of optimizing the limited space. There's even large tables in the back that can fit a group of five or more. Also did an outstanding job of decorating as well. Very authentic feel to the place.

Chicken Pad Thai
A nice sized portion, very worth the price. Had a nice spicy taste to it but they didnt include a wedge of lemon or lime to accommodate. A few things i didnt really like such as the noodles being over cooked and too soft, the chicken had a boiled taste and didnt integrate with the rest of the dish, obviously choice of meats were precooked and thrown into the dish to warm up. The tofu had the same case as the chicken.

Chicken Red Curry
Again a very nice sized portion for the price. The curry had a very nice coconut milk taste with a nicely spiced curry  flavor backing it up. The chicken was the same as the Pad Thai, thrown in and wasnt given enough time to integrate with the rest of the dish giving it a bland taste. The bamboo shoots could have been slices of bamboo instead of slivers, would have improved the taste and texture. 

Overall a huge improvement from the Japanese place they replaced. I'll be coming back to try out the menu some more.
Great larb and very friendly too. I will try some more dishes when over here and report back but i am hally i have found great larb so close!!!

This place wasn't as bad as some of the reviews were letting on. 
It was awkward when we first got there because we were the only people in the restaurant at 6:30pm on a sunday, is that a sign?
The waitress kept staring at us while waiting for our food and they kept on top of filling our water. She also doesn't speak very good english, those were really the only negatives. 
The food tasted just fine, we both got curries, a pumpkin curry and a musuman curry. They were good. No complaints. If we came back I would try something different.

Ordered pad Thai chicken and it was NOT tasty! The Thai tea is terrible as well! I eat Thai food at least twice a week and thought I'd give this place a try because it's close by..but do yourself a favor and drive down to rainbow or go to fort Apache for some good Thai food!

This is my go-to place for Laos Style Papaya. I'm sure most people won't find that very useful, considering that its not a popular dish. They do a really good job on it though. The spicy levels are perfect, the ingredients are fresh, and the portions are large. If you like Laos Papaya, I encourage you to give this place a try, because a lot of places in Vegas mess it up. They're either way too sweet or not even close to being spicy enough. This place always nails it though.

The staff is very friendly and some have been able to recognize my voice on the phone and know what I'm ordering.

Only complaint is sticky rice is a bit pricey at $3 for a small ball of it :(

I typically don't compain.  We have been to this restaurant several times with great experiences.  Today I ordered something different off of their menu - prawn scampi with lobster sauce.  Sounded good enough.  When the plate was delivered, it looked delicious however; once I started to cut up the shrimp they literally left every bit of poop in it imaginable.  I understand it is a tedious process to devein shrimp and at times some may be missed - but they clearly didn't attempt to clean any of it.  I called to the waitress and pointed out the issue.  She took the plate back to the kitchen and about 2 minutes later, came back with the plate in hand and said "what do you want to do with it?" - really? I don't care what you do, I am not eating it! Without even offering if I wanted something else, I asked for chicken pad thai.  She told the cook of the order change, came back and stated that I will get the pad thai at the price of the prawn scampi...ummm?? At least $6 difference.  I disputed the charge period as why should I pay anything for shrimp that was flat out dirty?!? - Anyways if you eat here, check your sh** literally.  Shrimp was absolutely filthy....FAIL and last time I will even go here.  Surang's Thai Kitchen is a million times better and more flavorful...

I have eaten here many, many ties over the past couple of years. I am a vegan and they are always very careful to prepare my food without any fish, shrimp or oyster stuff. The papaya salad is one of the best I have ever had anywhere. The servers are extremely nice.

My *only* complaint; PLEASE, some new music! Lol! The piano Musak versions of 80s ballads is enough to drive me to the loony bin! I think some hip, down-tempo eastern influence stuff would do the trick, as the restaurant is comfortable inside vibe wise, it's just that music that is way beyond worn out... other than that, Benjarong is awesome!

This  restaurant has horrible food. This was my first time and last time eating food from here.
I asked that my entree to be made with less salt. Are they so dumb that they put so much salt on my food that I had to throw it away.They don't understand a simple request here.  I should have known better that when I got to the restaurant, there were no customers dining inside.
That should have been my clue to get the hell out of here.If you like your food covered with heaps of salt, then dine here. What a rip off!!!  I wasted my time and money here, NEVER AGAIN . Don't waste your money here.This place should be called BenjaWRONG!!!!!!!

this place is always hits the spot. I love the curry and pad thai and everyone I send here loves it too! Not only is the food delicious but you get a lot of it for a little money. They have great lunch specials!

II was looking forward to some good fried rice this evening. So I ventured into Benjarong Thai restaurant. I ordered the Benjarong fried rice. I was the only patron in the restaurant on a Friday night around 8pm. That was my RED flag!. Not a patron in the house, but me!!. I placed my order, it came quickly, too quickly. It was thrown together. The rice was kinda mushy also. Large Chuck's of meat, ( I had no knife either). I tried to eat it, but I couldn't. It made me nauseous. I asked for the bill, they asked if I wanted a to go box, I declined. I left the uneaten entree & I paid my bill, vowed never to go back, & yelp my reviews. I will stick to Archi's.  The waitress did not acknowledge my obvious discontent.

WALK AWAY!!!  -  As fast as you can :) You have options! Las Vegas has too many other similar restaurants within minutes that would give you quality food and be grateful for you spending your hard working money with them.  Food can be good on some visits. However, food can also be absolutely awful and not authentic or even close to it. Do you feel lucky today? :) Consistency is vital. 

1 star = food was not cooked right, missing obvious ingredients, and they refused to own up to their mistake. Also, since I live within three minutes from this place, I have been placing orders and eating in many many many times; as a business, your clients are the ones paying for your own  food. Know that. I, for one, I would not visit this business again, nor do I recommend it to my worst enemy...though that would be hard, since I do not have enemies. I might after posting this review :))
Great thai food for our neighborhood.  Try anything. It's great.  Recommend pad see eww.   Don't forget to spice it up!!!!
Food has zero flavor. Everything tastes watered down and old. Even the Thai tea was disguising. So disappointing

Talk about finding solid spot for Thai food. Honestly it gives my only five star Archi run for its money comes too Thai food in Vegas. I was originally going to try different spot down the road but since the place closed down like next on the bookmark. Talk about lunch specials that by far tops Archi comes to bang for your buck. The chicken satay lunch special with choice of entree and still getting soup/nice little salad plus fried egg roll and wonton. All for basically ten dollars with tax. Steal of deal in my mind. The food speak for itself. Solid solid Thai food.

The soup not sure if changes from day to day. It reminding me of congee with the rice and other goodies in it. It the perfect hearty soup start meal on Vegas winter day. The salad was nice the house dressing was solid. The fried egg roll and wonton is exactly that nothing special. The chicken satay get two skewers not huge more appetizers portion but perfect amount consider all the food you get. I ordered the sweet basil (ground chicken for protein). I went 3 since first time and had no idea the heat scale they do. The three was pretty mello just fyi. You get choice of rice steamed rice, or fried rice. Not sure if charge for brown rice but they do have it as an option. Everything I had was delicious. Compare to Archi if dealing with crowds is not your cup of tea should come too Benjarong cause came at prime lunch time not very busy. The food really good. The service was just as good. They were really nice, never had empty glass, and got the vibe small family run restaurants. 

Not doubt be coming back again try more of the lunch specials!!!! =)))

I've had a very hit-and-miss experience with Benjarong. 

It's a very small, cozy restaurant with a hole-in-the-wall, third-world-country feel. The wait staff all wears vests brandishing the restaurant logo. 

My first visit to the restaurant, I was having a very late lunch in the middle of the afternoon. I was the only customer present. This is great if you prefer some solitude. The service was friendly. I ordered the beef salad lunch special and was happy.  This is the only Thai restaurant to which I have been thus far that has beef salad as a lunch special option.

There are two types of lunch specials: The "regular" lunch special and the "combo" lunch special. The combo lunch special comes with a chicken sate skewer, peanut sauce, and fried rice as compared with the regular lunch special. 

My second visit was two months later during more "regular" lunch hours. There were two other parties in the restaurant. The wait staff looked like they hated their lives. I ordered a pad thai lunch special with beef. Their noodles seemed a bit soggy and the beef was tough.

Fortunately for Thai cuisine lovers and unfortunately for Benjarong, the neighborhood is peppered with Thai restaurants that are not nearly as hit-and-miss. I would in general pass on this one and drive a mile to a better option.

The food here is always inconsistent. Depending on which chef is working that shift, you may experience good to not so good food. And if the food isn't good, they won't fix your order. For example, if you complain the food is too salty/ Spicy/etc, this is what they will tell you, "it's how the food is suppose to taste." 
Just today I ordered a noodle soup, chicken combo, and curry for delivery. I asked the waitress what the spice levels were and she told me 1-10. I asked for 8, making it clear I wanted it very spicy. I specifically said "I want it Very spicy, please". When the food was delivered, it wasn't spicy AT ALL. Like, ZERO spice. Not to mention, other things were disappointing about the order; the rice was over cooked, the papaya salad was bland, and the green beans were mushy. So, I called to make a complaint but only about the food not being spicy AT ALL. The waitress says, "that is spicy." (As if she tasted it)  And then she hung up on me. I proceeded to call her back (I wanted to know why she hung up on maybe it was an accident) but she hung up on me again. I called her back to ask for her name and she hung up on me a third time. Just wow. I guess hanging up on a customer is easier than simply apologizing for an incorrect order. At this point, I lost all my appetite and my husband and I felt so disrespected we decided to drive over to the restaurant and personally return the food. When we got there, I asked the waitress for her name again, but she would not give it to me. Instead, she told us that we wouldn't be getting a refund and if we wanted it spicy, we should've asked for a level 15 (on a 1-10 scale? ) And then, she told us to talk to the owner if we have a problem. She just had us wait for the owner to arrive, without giving us any specific time as to when he/she will be arriving. I was with my husband and two toddlers. We all just waited uncomfortably inside the restaurant for more than half an hour before the waitress decided to come hand us the refund. We weren't able to speak to the owner. We didn't receive any apologies. I don't know what happened to the owner or if the owner was even suppose to show up or if she just wanted to make us wait for no reason but it took her over 40 minutes to give us a refund. To say the very least, the level of disrespect was uncalled for and I hope none of you will ever experience this type of disrespect either. We will NEVER be returning. *And I hope that the owner of this restaurant will read this review and train their employees to practice better customer service.

OK...I'm not going to take away a star yet, because things happen...I understand. I spent 4 years in service.

But...one thing should NEVER happen. I should never find a dime size shard of GLASS in my curry.

You are officially put on notice Benjarong. One more screw up and I'm gonna drive the extra 2 miles to the next place.

Went to dinner here recently. The food was very bland and pretentious. The pineapple fried rice was served in an actual pineapple. Looks like they care about presentation than having actual flavor in their fried rice. The raisins used in the rice tasted funky and the spices were so bland that we dunked the chicken from this dish in peanut sauce from our appetizer. I also ordered mixed veggies in a garlic oyster sauce. Bland and not a good mix / variety of veggies. It's 80% carrots and cucumbers. 2 pieces of broccoli and a small piece of cabbage for 9 or 10 bucks. Total rip off. I'll never come back and advise you to go to David Wongs pan Asian up the street on Durango. It's 100000 times better than this dump.

This place is awesome! I always order from this place as I lived just a street away. Their Salmon Steak dinner is always good. The restaurant itself is a little small, I think their main business is delivery and take out, but what they did to that limited space is impressive. Other places could take a lesson or two in great customer service from the folks working here. Everything is reasonably priced and as someone who loves quirky stuff, they have a black colored toilet in the bathroom. Which was really clean too, by the way.

Been craving for Beef satay and we live close by.  Their beef satay's not all that, their pad thai though was yummy. We went on a slow day, i guess, and it was so awkward, the girls would just stand there and watch you eat. Would be nicer if we could enjoy our meal without them watching us chew our food

Server needs to learn how to smile. She was a good waitress but you gotta smile. The food was good. Got the chicken pad Thai lunch special. Chicken and rice soup needed help. But everything else was top notch. Not a bad place at all.

I finally got around to visiting this one.  A few people have asked me now if I've been here, and it is just so far from my house!  It was totally worth the trip though.  I was impressed.  Benjarong is a gourmet Thai restaurant that is taking American Thai food to the next level.  I ordered the Salmon steak green curry ($15.99) and the Crab papaya salad ($8.99).

The crab papaya salad was pretty good.  It was slightly sweet with no vinegar, but the flavor went well with the crab legs.  The crab legs themselves had to be cracked.  They weren't the best crab legs I have ever had, and there were only three of them, but this was a really nice addition to the dish.  The one downside is that I wouldn't say this was an authentically flavored papaya salad, and Thais might be disappointed in this classic dish.   The portion was huge though, and I couldn't even finish half of it.  

Next up was the salmon green curry.  This had a beautiful presentation, with a light green curry sauce with green peas, spread in a thin layer over the dish.  The portion of salmon was healthy, and the quality was too.  The curry sauce was a bit sweet, but I could tell it was a homemade curry sauce, and was well made.  It reminded me of the style of curry served at Pan Asian, but lighter.  I liked the fact that there wasn't a soup of this curry.  That would have been too sweet.  The curry was used like a light sauce rather than a traditional fully loaded soupy or chunky curry.  It went really well with the salmon in such a refined way.  The salmon, while deliciously prepared, did have a few bones. In Thailand, the bones are eaten, but this could bother some Western patrons.  Take it from me though, the dish was worth the few little bones.  

I was impressed by this Thai restaurant.  It fits in well with the area, and goes for an affordable, but upscale atmosphere and food style.  There are a few dishes on the menu that I don't believe I have tried.  Some of the dishes are definitely a bit Americanized, but they are done well.  I have a feeling that digging deeper into the menu would result in finding some good, authentic dishes.  I wish I lived closer so that I could explore this Thai restaurant a little more.

3.5 stars. This is a place we love to hate, if you know what I mean! We love it because it's so close to the house, which makes for convenient, last minute dinner plans. We don't like it because they're a bit more on the pricey side (for Thai food). They always seem to mess something up on or order. Most recently they forgot to give us our streamed rice to go along with our curry. They're a bit "cheap" with their rice too! They provide a small container of steamed rice for twice the amount of curry. If you ask for more rice they want to charge you $3! That's including when we order multiple curry entrees! We always end making our own rice at home because the proportions never mount up.

On a positive note, the wait staff are very pleasant, although it is very difficult to communicate with them. The veggie green curry is outstanding and so is the Thai dumplings, according to my fiance. I always get the Thai noodle soup and have them make it vegan for me. I always ask for no MSG, it tastes swell without that crap. We also tried green curry with scallops, scallops were over cooked and miniature! save your $2 and stay away from that. The brown fried rice is okay, a little on the greasy side, so its good for hangovers I guess. He also had the jungle curry once and doesn't recommend it, watery and bland. If you are dining in, they have 2 for 1 Thai coffee or Thai tea between 7 & 9pm.
This place was good but not amazing. The price was really high in my opinion for the quality of food. I have another Thai place I am going to stick with.
I've been coming here for years! Wish I could stop by a lot more. Friendly service and great food. Panang Curry is amazing, my girlfriend loves the chicken pad thai. Thai Tea happy hour after 7!

I have gone to this restaurant for years, and ordered over the phone many times as well. I always got the pumpkin curry, because it was good and one of the only things vegan. I had a painful time ordering over the phone on my final delivery experience with them. It took over 5 minutes of repeating every detail and spelling out my address. When the food showed up, it was green curry. I called to let them know, and they told me it was my fault because she had said it back to me. Basically, their employee's poor communication was my fault. They refused to do anything about it. I refuse to do business with them anymore.

I had the pleasure of dining here with a friend who is Thai and she was not so impressed. Many dishes were prepared on the sweet side to appeal to "American tastes" she said.

Useless trivia: the name of the restaurant refers to special, golden dishes or bowls that symbolize women having power.

Very nice place to eat. Service was prompt and attentive. Very clean in apperence though I did see a board of health violation notice posted on the wall. It looked as if they had some sorta minor labeling problem so not a big deal. 

I ordered the Chicken Pineapple Curry. I was quite suprised to have it come in a pineapple, how cool! It was very tasty. A mixture of chicken, peas, red and green bell peppers and onion in red curry coconut milk. It was all cooked to perfection. 

A side of steamed jasmine rice was served on the side. 

Priced at just under 8 bucks with a soda I got a full stomach of great food for less than 20 dollars. I highly recommend giving it a try.

I often drive by this spot and just assumed that it was another fast food thai joint. I was very wrong. The staff is very attentive and very friendly. The place is quite small but my friend and I were seated immediately. I ordered the pad kee mao and a bowl of chicken tom yum. My friend ordered some red chicken curry and then we ordered the fried banana rolls and a mango with sticky rice. My pad kee mao was surprisingly delicious. It was cooked just right so that the noodles stayed intact until the very last bite. Not too much sauce, just enough flavor. The soup was a bit sub-par, but then again, I am measuring it against the tom yum from Komol. I ordered everything at a level 7 spicy which the waitress said would be pretty spicy, but it was not spicy at all. That's fine, I just added a shitload of spicies from their little jars of fiery goodness. Now on to the dessert. WOW. The banana rolls were just sweet enough to satisfy my sweet tooth. The mango with sticky rice was probably the best I have ever had. They put a little more coconut milk in the rice than I am used to and it made a world of difference. The mango was also very ripe and sweet. It was good overall and I would recommend this place.

I've only had lunch here, and they have very good lunch specials starting at $6.25 that includes soup, salad, spring roll, and an entree.  
The lunch special I had recently, was not quite as generous a portion as I had in recent months, and the soup of the day has never changed (at least during the lunch hour), but the flavor is always well balanced from the beef chow mein to the salad dressing.  Service is usually top notch.

Food is good here, and it is well priced.

Docked 1 start because of the attitude problem the young waitress has.

Put a smile on woman! you're in the service industry. 

left a $5 tip because the young gentleman was nice to us!

The lunch specials are extremely reasonable.  $6-7 for soup or salad, entree, steamed rice or fried rice, spring roll, and wonton.

You can add chicken satay (2 pieces) for $10 total with all of the above.

We ordered the Chicken Yellow Curry and the Ground Chicken Pad Prik Pow.

Both were really good.  The Yellow Curry was well spiced but I found the food to be just a little bit salty. 

Nevertheless, the food and service was excellent.  It's small, intimate and should be a must for anyone who lives in the Rhodes Ranch/Mountains Edge area.  And they deliver!!

The food was delicious and the prices for lunch were awesome. My husband had the bbq pork with fried rice lunch plate, it came with soup and a free soda for 7.95. i had chicken yellow curry and it came with a spring roll, soup, salad, fried rice and chicken satay and a free soda for 9.95. I dont think you can beat the price, everything was well made and fresh.

Let me start off with: The music at this place is jamming! Old school music like Beegees and Richard Marx. BUT all in instrumental. Soothing, made me want to eat more.

Anyways....

Benjarong is a nice small and quiet neighborhood restaurant.  The staff there were all really friendly and made sure that we had everything we needed. The menu offered several choices. We ended up choosing Crab Rangoons (I know, I should have went more THAI), green pork curry with extra eggplant, and chicken pad thai.

The crab rangoons were alright. I guess I should expect that since it is a thai restaurant.  Too much cream cheese, not enough crab.. And the cream cheese was still a bit firm. 

The food came out pretty damn fast.. LIke lightning fast. I was like DAMN that's fast. Really, that's what I said in my head as I saw the food arriving.

The green curry was my favorite part. It had a nice kick but I wish the eggplant was cut bigger. It was thinly sliced so it was hard to really taste the flavor of the eggplant (which is my favorite part of green curry). But nonetheless, the sauce was delicious with white rice which comes with your order.

The pad thai was sweet. If you need a little kick, make sure to ask for the spice tray as there is none on the table. I liked the sweetness of it. A little bit different that most other pad thai that I had. The sauce was thicker than what I am use to but it was good. 

Overall, a nice place with nice people and nice food.
One of the best in town besides pinkoaw. And def not the Americanized sweet stuff that other restaurants have swayed to do. I am Thai and I genuinely hate when they go this route.

I've been here one a while ago. The service and cleanliness was great. I got pineapple curry chicken. I liked it, as well as my companion, but I personally thought it needed a little more flavor/spice. If I remember correctly I think I felt like it was a bit more expensive than comparable restaurants. I haven't been back, not that I am opposed to it, I just haven't craved it.

I was very pleased to discover Benjarong so close to my home. I've never dined at the restaurant but I have ordered take out and sampled a number of menu items. 

I ordered satay chicken sticks and a sort of ground pork and vegetable rice dish, both of which were beyond sensational. The chicken was deliciously marinaded and seasoned and I loved their satay sauce and the rice dish stood on its own as a main meal - I'd gladly order it to eat for lunch or dinner anytime at all.

I also got a pork noodle soup which I was less crazy about, but this was probably because I tried to keep it for later (the following day) and by this time the noodles had begun to disintegrate into the soup, making things a bit gooey and nondescript.

The staff here were also really welcoming and friendly. They asked me "Where in England I was from" to which I replied my standard "The Australian part" (everyone in the USA seems to think I'm from England for some reason) and we had a bit of a laugh about this and we swapped anecdotes about friends and family who had been to Australia and about Thai food in Australia. It was all very jovial and pleasant.

I look forward to making this place one of my regular check-ins for Thai food.
Nice place, friendly staff. Got free soda! (Fridays only). Me and the wife ate the pad thai and crying tiger. Was happy with our food.

If there was NO stars they would receive that. One star is being generous; waitress couldn't understand enough English when we ordered salad and dressing on side.
Ordered jerky - talk about TOUGH CHEWY meat. My dog would like it.  Both Chix and Beef salad very salty. Again beef was chewy. When I explained this to her she couldn't understand and laughed.
I know it's not her fault the food was bad or meat tough - it's the chef or owner who orders the meat. 

However the owner should ensure if and when there is a problem their wait staff doesn't laugh and should get the manager involved.

She's lucky she even got a tip.
You don't laugh at customers when they are not happy.

Yum! Is what I will say about this experience. My food was hot and tasty. I didn't know what to get going in but I ordered the vegetables with pork. It was so good. I wanted to try the curry but I'm trying to eat a little healthier at this time. I will be back to try the infamous Thai Iced Tea though. The staff was very nice and down to earth. We chatted about the weather while I was waiting for my food order.
I love the food and the people here. The food is fresh and authentic my favorite is the fried tofu pad thai. The servers and wait staff are all family and really make you feel special check it out.
Worst customer service , lazy waitress. I guess you lost a good costumer in the neighborhood.

This is my first time writing a Yelp review as I am less than happy about the service. I came to pick up my lunch special and wanted a small thing of peanut sauce, just the 1 ounce one that the serve to go with their chicken satay. The person at the counter quoted me 50 cents which I paid for. After they spoke among themselves with the kitchen staff, she told me its actually $1. For a small tiny portion of peanut sauce, I feel that it's not good business sense to requote your customer plus charge for a tiny serving of sauce....I am not likely to return.

Great food. I definitely recommend the Crying Tiger. It's fantastic. Just poor on the entire cup of whatever it is that's served with it and enjoy. I also really like the Pad Thai, which is even better the next day. The Chicken Satay was good but next time we are asking to double the peanut sauce. We usually have it delivered and they generally arrive on or before the estimated time.

Love this place!
The food is amazing. My husband and I have been here several times over 3 years and the quality keeps getting better :)
Staff is friendly, clean, quiet romantic atmosphere.
The Panang curry at an 8, ooooohh mmmaaaan. LITERALLY the best thing I've EVER eaten.
We love their food!!! I had the coconut milk, lemon grass soup with chicken...and ginger prawn curry.

For a $10 lunch special you can get a soup, salad, pad Thai, chicken satay, and rice! It's an amazing place and I always LOVE going here! The service is fast and the food is amazing! I come here at least once a month and I absolutely love it!
I order here because I was starving, the food wasn't like how I'm use to, it was just ok edible but I will not be back

Good, quick service and flavorful food. 

It was our first time to Benjarong. The place is pretty tiny with probably less than 10 tables and it's not fancy by any means but the service was good and the food was too. 

We ordered edamame to start with some of their yummy Thai tea and I of course had to try their chicken pad Thai. The hubby got the Beef and Broccoli. The chicken pad Thai had great flavor. Did have to grab my lemon from my water though to squeeze onto it. I usually like to add lime to my pad Thai to break up the sweetness. Usually lime comes as a garnish. The noodles were a little overcooked so they kind of mushed together but I did like how it was packed with perfectly cooked chicken and fresh bean sprouts. I also tried my husband's Beef and Broccoli and thoroughly enjoyed the flavor of it. Fresh and flavorful. 

Overall this place deserves a solid 4 stars in my book. No, it's not a fancy Thai restaurant so if you want fancy you should venture elsewhere but the service was friendly and the food was a-okay.
Yellow curry is my favorite! Lunch special is the best deal. It comes with a soup and salad under $10. The place is very quit and clean. Many options to choose from.

First time and really enjoyed the food, the presentation and the feel of the dining room - just wish they had wine to go with it.  Had the chicken basil it was perfect. the staff are fabulous. A real winner!

Meal - Thai ice tea was good; red curry was what I expected; seafood fried rice was amazing, pineapple curry was bomb. Presentation was great.

Service - Waitstaff was attentive, filled the drinks and moved stuff out of the way before they brought the dishes. 

Ambiance - was just ok; didn't cast any mood over the meal. Music was strange, whatever... 

Bottom line - As good or better than any other thai I've had in town. Decent spot we'll return fasho.

It was lunch time a friend call " are you hungry, me : yes a little lol you know there's none open until 11am " friend:   I'm craving for Thai food, me: ok I'll meet you at Benjarong, we got the lunch special 

I order the spicy sweet chili basil beef noodles,comes with soup of the day, salad and egg roll and Thai tea and my friend order the chicken curry with fried rice, salad, egg roll and chicken pad Thai , she was hungry lol but end up she took the pad Thai home 

Overall service was great but the food was even better they adjust the spice level, clean and cozy atmosphere, I definitely will recommend and go back to try the other dishes.

This place is nice and quite and great for a low key dinner. The combination soup with shrimp is bomb. I also really like the chicken fried rice from here, I know I know super boring but great flavor. Pad Thai chicken also pretty good!
A good place to go for a quick but good dinner.
Walking distance to authentic Thai food at a reasonable price.  Lunch specials are awesome and service is great too!!

We have been ordering food from here for the past 5 years.  Every plate we have ever ordered has been correct and delicious.  The staff has always been friendly and has treated me with a great deal of respect.  The food has always been fresh and delicious.  We have never received food that was less than delicious.  My only suggestion is that when we ask for a 10 spicy on the scale from 1-10, please give us a 10.  All of the food we have ever ordered has never even been close to a 10.  We love spicy food.  I think they might hear an American voice and think we have a different spice tolerance.  We don't.  A 10 means a Thai 10, not what they might perceive as an American 10.  We cook very spicy foods and eat hot peppers with most of our meals.  While they do provide us with spicy pepper sauce on the side, that is not what I consider food that is a 10 on the spicy scale.  Food that is spicy is cooked with spice.  If I wanted my food to be spicy after the fact, I would add my own hot sauce.  I do have to say that although the entrees are consistently delicious and are always of high quality, they are also consistently more like a 1 on the spicy scale, NOT a 10.

Take out review!!! Well this place was the only Thai place near me that delivered and I was really craving beef pad thai. I got my order within 30 minutes...Score! It was hot, fresh, and yummy. We had spicy basil beef, crab rangoons, and beef pad thai. All were good except the crab rangoons, I have had way better, but for a fast order like this they were OK. My husband says he gives the basil beef 4 stars. Liked the pad Thai it wasn't the best but it was good. The giroy that took my order was nice and the delivery guy was very polite as well.  Very convenient and I would definitely order it again if I want Thai food that delivers!

Good not great about sums this place up.
No ambiance, no alcohol and OK food at pretty high prices.
Thai place by the Lakes is still best around in my opinion. 
Had the Duck and the Catfish choo chee curry

This place is probably one of my favorite Thai places here in the valley. I always go for their lunch special because it's cheaper and you get a lot of food. You get an entree, soup, and salad for the price on one meal. I enjoy their spicy ground chicken with basil, yellow curry, or beef salad. Their soup is perfect and warm. They have this really good dipping sauce for their egg rolls that come with the lunch special. Overall, I love this place. My go to place for really good authentic Thai food.

We've been coming here for years. Our most common order consists of a combination of the following: chicken satay, green chicken curry, duck basil and mango sticky rice. Overall, we've been pleased with this restaurant. Usually we take our order to go. My only complaint would be they're a little light on the protein but overall pretty satisfied.
This is my husband and my favorite little place. We order from them every Friday. They are always friendly and the food is great.

Pineapple Shrimp Curry served in an actual Pineapple- too cute!!!! Loved the presentation and the tangy pineapple taste as well. I thought a good amount of shrmp was given too....
Crab Pad See Ew was good but nothing too special.They use real crab but didn't cook together with the noodles instead it was just sprinkled on top of the finished product. Weird....
BF always has to get Tom Yum Soup- I'm not a fan cause I just think "Stinky Soup" anyways I did taste  it and I have tasted better!!!!
Eggrolls- Pretty good...
All in all I'm glad we tried this place-the ladies working there were helpful & nice, the place was small but clean and service was quick. I enjoy it when places serve food out of the norm and this place has a good balance of that. I will be back.....

It always smells really good in this restaurant, like a bakery always makes me hungry.  Really fast and courteous service, it seems like this is a family business and they take a lot of pride in their offerings... Every dish is garnished and presented with a flourish.  The pineapple curry is simply the best Thai dish I have ever had....

The food is OK, but here's the problem: I'm a Vegetarian and from some reason, no matter how much I ask, they just don't respect that!!! Every time I went there or picked up my food (4 times total, kept giving the place a chance) - I was disappointed, because THEY ALWAYS PUT MEET IN MY FOOD!!! I asked for a plain noodle soup, specifically asked for vegetables and noodles ONLY, repeated the fact I'm a vegetarian and am asking for A VEGETARIAN SOUP, and they put beef inside. A few months ago I ordered a rice paper spring roll, at the second bite I found out I've had shrimps inside! What's up with that?!? We called VERY ANGRY today once we figured out I've had beef in my soup, and the lady would not give us a refund for that (BTW, it's a 9$ soup!). This is so annoying and inconsiderate. I'm definitely NOT coming back.
This place is great! We eat here pretty often. Staff is very friendly and courteous. Try the beef brown fried rice...my favorite dish..
I think this is one of our most fave Thai places here in Vegas. They serve AUTHENTIC Thai dishes, we ordered the spicy basil beef (lunch special) with thai milk tea. Love it!

Came here for lunch since I was in the area for work. Ordered the lunch special pad thai and Thai tea. I love Thai food, but for some reason this place didn't hit the spot. The pad Thai was very sweet, and the Thai tea was also too sweet. I told the server about the my food/drink being too sweet. She didn't seem to care and didn't even bother to waive the Thai tea. This place has horrible food and horrible customer service. I asked to speak with a manager and the servers just played dumb like they didn't understand what I was saying. It was my first time eating here and definitely my last. If you want good authentic real Thai food check out lotus of Siam, Archi's Thai Bistro, and/or Thai BBQ.

This place is awesome! It has one of the best thai ice teas I have ever had, not too sweet. The food has a different flavor profile than what I am used to (more savory flavors) but it was a nice change. I have been here 3 times and will continue to come every time I'm in town. Last time I was in it was buy one get one free for thai iced teas so I had 4 :)

I ordered papaya salad To-go. Brought it home and box smelled sour and fermented. I called to tell the store and was transferred three times. I told them it smelled old and they said it was made today. I wanted my money back and they refused. they just told me bring it back so they can make me another. Like hell im going to give them a chance to spit in my food! Lost my business for sure

Came here on a whim because I love Thai food. Place was fairly nice and clean. Staff was really friendly and service was very fast. I had the pad Thai lunch special which ended up being around $11, which I think is a little overpriced but they did give a lot. Pad Thai was a little bit sweeter for my taste and the side salad had a sort of coconut dressing which was interesting but not for me. All in all, I would recommend this place but it is somewhat overpriced.

I thought this was more of a fast food place, but after I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised to see the nicely decorated sit down restaurant.  The wait staff was very nice and talked to my 5 year old which he enjoyed.  The tom kha koong soup was delicious!!! I loved the flavors! However, I wish they would remove the ingredients you don't eat (those that are just cooked with for flavor) before they serve it. I liked the pineapple curry sauce for the most part, but next time will ask it to be less spicey. The tofu was soso. My husband ordered the veggie pad thai. That was delicious as well! Will be back! It's in a convenient location and I love Tom Kha soup so that's my new spot for it!!

On a side note: I really appreciated the fact that the waitress asked if my son had peanut allergies because the dish he ordered had peanut sauce. I've never had someone actually take the time to think about that and ask. :)
Love the egg fried rice and pad see ew! We've eaten here many times. We visit Thailand often and this is the most authentic restaurant we've found in Vegas! Wonderful food!

This place was dead when we got there. The prices were a bit munch. We ordered beef satay and got the hardest kind of meat to chew. The meat was so thin and gross. The only tasty thing we had were the pad se eww noodles. The chicken in the noodles was rough. The BBQ thai chicken was dry too.

This actually was the first restaurant I went to when I officially moved to Las Vegas, and I've been back three times for dinner (dine in).   This last time was my last.

The food is solid.   I'm a huge fan of their papaya salad, and have had a variety of their other dishes, including curries and the BBQ chicken. I like the variety of the menu, and the fact that you can request a spice level which exceeds normal western palettes (and they aren't afraid to give you the spice level you order).   I did try a cupcake for dessert on this last visit (not sure why I would order a cupcake in a Thai restaurant), and would strongly suggest never to order them.

The reason I'm not returning is the service.   I agree with other reviewers that the servers hated their lives.  Yes,  the water glasses were filled and the dishes brought out promptly.  But, I was so uncomfortable with their level of misery at being there, that after paying the bill and exiting the restaurant, my husband and I both looked at each other and said not again.

I'm crazy about this place! The delicious food, awesome employees and just the relax atmosphere of this Thai restaurant. I come here very often my all time favorite is the home style duck and I'm telling you it's bomb.com lol, come see for yourself it's authentic that you can really taste. Plus they do delivery

I will give 3.5 start if I can.     
    The venue is small but gives a very cozy feeling. They only have about 10 tables and they are very close to each other. Service is great and the staffs are very friendly and helpful. They each have a great smile and make you feel welcomed and "hommie". 
     We ordered Benjarong's Signature Pad Thai and Pork Curry with white rice. Pad Thai comes in a very big portion and it has pretty much everything in it: shrimp, pork, chicken and beef. The sauce is good but it could be more juicy. We ordered level 5 in spiciness and it is not spicy at all, same situation with the curry. I wasn't too impressed with the curry, it is a bit too watery for me and the portion is kind of small compared to the Pad Thai, more potatoes than pork for sure. I will say with the same price, Pad Thai is surely the one to go to. My boyfriend, who lives around the corner and often comes here for the curry and rice to go, thinks they give out bigger portion when it is in the box. 
    I am wiling to come back to try out other dishes here.

I have been here several times. Usually the food is good with good service. The last time however my sister and I both ordered shrimp pad Thai lunch special.  Their shrimp was old and really really fishy we both sent it back. They did not make this new plates what they did was pick the shrimp out of the noodles and then put chicken in and served it to us again. When I asked the waitress if the shrimp was just removed, she confirmed it. I could still taste the fish flavor in the supposedly new chicken dish. The manager then tried to say it was all brand new, which it was very obviously not. I told her that I would pay for one meal only as we had already eaten the salad and soup that came with the lunch special; she tried to tell me that I didn't just get to decide what I would pay for. I said I was being generous and I felt fair to offer to even pay for one meal. After some grumbling she finally agreed to only charge for one meal. I tipped the waitress on what would've been the full price. I will not be back and really should've called the health department.

The worst Thai food we've ever had ! We ordered chicken satay (it was the only good item we ordered ) . Bbq chicken was very dry, crab pad thai was nasty , it had a weird smell. Also prawns with lobster sauce was fishy . Waitress wasn't helpful at all. We ordered our food to go. As she gave our food which took about 30 minutes to get, not to mention there was only two other tables. She was standing there waiting for a tip. Terrible food & service. NEVER AGAIN !!!
Had a delicious meal here. Service was 5 stars and so was the food. The place was not busy at all. Plenty of tables and parking. A+

This is definitely my go to place now for Garlic Chicken. I might not have a very diverse pallet of things I like as far as Thai food but I have been on a long quest to find the awesome Garlic Chicken since moving from San Diego. While there are tons of food here that we didn't even have in San Diego much less being way better than there I had yet to come across a good Garlic Chicken. THIS is my go to Garlic Chicken place now. I also enjoyed their satay and the egg rolls and the homemade sauce is awesome as well.

not very good... not even a good bargain.. i don't even understand how you can make such terrible thai food.. unless you are just using all the worst ingredients possible.. 

it was fast though thats why it even gets two stars

It's pretty good.  It's the closest Thai food to those of us in the far SW and it's decent.  A lot of dishes are rather bland like others have said but if you ask for more spicy (like level 10) then it'll have a lot of kick. Definitely over priced as 3 entrees will go for like $45 bucks but like I said it's decent and I'll hit this place up again for takeout when I'm in the mood.
I've dined in and taken out multiple times and everything has always been good! And the staff is really, really nice (and super attentive!). Definitely worth a try!

One of our favorite Thai restaurants out in Vegas. I moved from Palm Springs, where I worked at a Thai restaurant. I'm utterly obsessed with Thai food, and the spices they cook with. My fianc and I love this place, the food is great, the waitresses are very accommodating without being overbearing, and it's greatly priced. Good job! :)

This is my go-to Thai place when I need quick Thai satisfaction. It is close to me and they have great food. I never really dine in and order to go a lot. There is usually never anyone eating inside. I have maybe seen 1 person eating inside.. It is very small with just a few tables. I usually order Pad Thai or different curries. All have been amazing. They have great lunch specials as well. You get a spring roll, small salad and wonton with the lunch portion when you order it. Make sure to order your Thai tea, cause why not. It is good!

This was our third time going to Benjarong. Overall this time was the best Thai meal we've had in a while. We usually order Tom Yum Koong,Chicken Pad Thai, and Beef Salad for dinner. We saw that they had a combo meal that had five items, Tom Yum Koong, Spring Rolls,Spicy Ground Chicken, Thai beef salad, and we asked if we could try the crispy pad thai instead of the regular pad thai rice noodle.  Jasmine Rice was also included. All this for $40, the meal was of course more than enough for four people. The Crispy Pad Thai is my new favorite dish. All the dishes were very yummy!  We didn't get to finish our meal but I took home the leftovers not wanting to waste anything.
Compared to the other Thai restaurants I've tried in the southwest area(e.g. Archies, Panna, Pin Kaow) This restaurant has become my favorite for Thai food. I like their authentic thai flavors, good service, and portion for the price.  They also deliver.

My partner and I are obsessed with Thai curry. That being said, we've tried just about every flavor at Benjarong and loved all of them. The service is always prompt and friendly, and the portions are great for the price. We go at least once a month or so and will continue to do so!

This place was a fantastic find! Really homey with local vibe. The food had a very unique Thai flavor profile that was more savory and aromatic than some others I've had, plus they took great care with presentation. Service was deft and professional. Fantastic place!

I think this place is pretty good but not excellent.  I eat take out from them often because the location is super convenient for me.   I typically order 1 of 2 things... either ground basil chicken or shrimp pad thai.  And I order everything at a spicy level 8.  Both those dishes are great in my opinion.  But once I ordered some crab rangoons... worst I've ever had. Once I ordered the thai dumplings and they were only ok. And tonight I got a combo of shrimp and chicken in my pad thai.  The shrimp were excellent as usual,  but the chicken was super dry and chewy.  In the future I'll stick with my 2 usual orders that I know are good

I had this Thai food delivered and I'm impressed! 

I had the Chicken Pad Thai, and Beef Laarb Salad. Both were delicious! The Beef Laarb had so much flavor! The Pad Thai wasn't too greasy and had great flavor. It took about 45 minutes to be delivered which I think is pretty standard. I will definitely be ordering again to fill my Thai food cravings!
We got there 15min before closing and they were able to serve us and were so pleasant! Their tom yum ga was amazing and pad see ew was good as well. Can't wait to go back.

Finally tried this food today and it was fabulous. I had the chicken pad Thai lunch special and everything was delicious. It came with rice, chicken satay skewers which were fabulous,spinach salad and a little spring roll and wonton. Place is tiny and very clean. We ordered to go and everything arrived home hot and packaged nicely. The lunch special is a lot of food. Can't wait to return.
My favorite Thai restaurant in town~  I'm always looking for the best crab papaya salad (som tum), beef jerky, laab... And they nail it. Very authentic and delicious!

We've been to this place 4 or 5 times. Each time, we're impressed. I almost always order the Drunken Noodle dish - not sure what it's really called, but they seem to know what I want when I say "Drunken Noodle." :)
My husband is vegan - so he gets Thai Curry with vegetables and Tofu. 

Great food - great service. LOVE their mango sticky rice too.

Thai place is great 
Very friendly service and food is excellent 
I always get the green curry spicy level 1 
It's the best I've had so far in Vegas 

Never disappoints

Wait time was fast although there were not any people ahead of us in line.

Service is great. Waitress are very attentive.

Food is okay. Larb was very salty. Papaya Salad (Laotion style) was incredible. I would come back here to try more dishes.
This girl literally rolled her eyes at me when I asked for a bigger box HAHAHAHA foods great, service needs work

First time going there today and I think this is some of the best yellow curry I've had all year! It is absolutely delicious and flavorful. I asked for a level 2 and got a level 2 which is important to me. The service was okay. Not bad not great but I will definitely be going back. Because I called in my order and carried out, I can't speak to the service as a sit down customer. I also think the decor is dark, I wish it was more light and airy, but not a deal breaker. Overall, the food is amazing and i think I may have found my local Thai restaurant.

I am originally from Bangkok, Thailand. This restaurant relieved my homesick feeling. All the dishes I ordered are a good representative for authentic Thai food; for example, papaya salad, crying tiger, nam klook, larb. I gave all the stars for both taste and service. Thai food reviewed by Thai, trust me and enjoy our authentic one, not Americanized Thai.
